alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 28 at 1:52AM MST until July 28 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of northern Arizona including Navajo Nation and Hopi Tribal Lands. Area slot canyons will be especially prone to flash flooding. * WHEN...Through early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Stay out of slot canyons. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall has created saturated soils across the region, including the Navajo and Hopi Nations. Additional showers and thunderstorms are likely, further increasing the flash flood threat. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
